text:
BREAKING: OpenAI launched ChatGPT Agent.

ChatGPT can think, plan, and execute tasks by itself:

1. It found 20 Reddit posts with ChatGPT prompts. 
2. It built a list of LinkedIn creators in the AI niche. 
3. It crafted outreach messages for connections. 
4. It researched VC investments for AI SaaS apps. 
5. It created a downloadable investor deck in just 20 minutes.

This would have taken you 5-10 hours a week and $4000

It works like a team of 10 PhD interns.

We're seeing the rise of a new skill: Agent Management.

As agents learn to work autonomously, those who master them will be ahead in the game.

It is still not there yet. 
But this is the worst it can ever be. 

Every major AI model will soon add an agent mode.

We are entering the era of solo founders.

♻️ More AI guides (for free) at how-to-ai.store
